main_definition: Enterprise refers to an undertaking, especially a business or commercial organization, that involves initiative and risk-taking.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of starting or organizing a new business or venture
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of saving money, he decided to enterprise by opening his own restaurant.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An ambitious project requiring ingenuity and determination
meanings_and_examples.example: The space mission was a bold enterprise that required the collaboration of multiple countries.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group or organization with the purpose of achieving a particular goal, often involving risk-taking
meanings_and_examples.example: She joined an environmental enterprise focused on cleaning up local rivers and streams.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The quality of being adventurous and willing to take risks
meanings_and_examples.example: His entrepreneurial spirit made him a natural fit for the start-up environment, embodying true enterprise.
